title: Airbus A320 Illustrated Parts Catalog - Chapter 24: Electrical Power
content: This Illustrated Parts Catalog (IPC) provides detailed parts information for the electrical power system (ATA Chapter 24) of the Airbus A320 aircraft. It includes part numbers, illustrations, and assembly diagrams for all electrical system components, including generators, batteries, contactors, transformers, and distribution panels.

sections.title: Introduction
sections.content:
This Illustrated Parts Catalog (IPC) provides detailed parts information for the electrical power system (ATA Chapter 24) of the Airbus A320 aircraft. The catalog is organized according to the Air Transport Association (ATA) specification 100 chapter system.

This catalog is intended for use by properly trained and qualified maintenance personnel. All part replacements must be performed in accordance with the appropriate maintenance manuals and applicable regulatory requirements.

The catalog is regularly updated to incorporate the latest parts information. Always ensure you are using the most current revision. The revision status can be verified on the Revision Status page or through the Airbus Customer Portal.

Cross-reference: For maintenance procedures, refer to the Airbus A320 Aircraft Maintenance Manual (doc-006).

sections.title: How to Use This Catalog
sections.content:
2.1 CATALOG ORGANIZATION

This catalog is organized by ATA chapter, section, subject, and figure number. The electrical power system is covered in ATA Chapter 24, which is divided into the following sections:

- 24-00: General
- 24-10: AC Power Generation
- 24-20: AC Power Distribution
- 24-30: DC Power Generation
- 24-40: DC Power Distribution
- 24-50: AC/DC Power Control
- 24-60: Electrical Load Management

Each section contains figures that illustrate assemblies and components. Each figure is accompanied by a parts list that provides the following information:

- Item Number: Corresponds to the callout number in the illustration
- Part Number: Manufacturer's part number
- Description: Name and description of the part
- Units Per Assembly: Number of parts used in the assembly
- Effectivity: Aircraft serial numbers or configurations to which the part applies
- Spares Category: Indicates recommended spares stocking level

2.2 PART NUMBER IDENTIFICATION

Part numbers in this catalog use the following format:

- Airbus part numbers: AXXXXXXXX (A followed by 8 digits)
- Vendor part numbers: As assigned by the vendor, often with a prefix indicating the vendor

2.3 EFFECTIVITY CODES

The following effectivity codes are used in this catalog:

- ALL: Applies to all aircraft
- MSNXXXX: Applies to aircraft with manufacturer serial number XXXX and subsequent
- MSNXXXX-YYYY: Applies to aircraft with manufacturer serial numbers from XXXX through YYYY
- PRE-MSNXXXX: Applies to aircraft with manufacturer serial numbers before XXXX

2.4 SPARES CATEGORY CODES

The following spares category codes are used in this catalog:

- A: High usage, recommended for line station stocking
- B: Medium usage, recommended for main base stocking
- C: Low usage, recommended for overhaul facility stocking
- D: Very low usage, procure as needed

2.5 CROSS-REFERENCE INDEXES

The following cross-reference indexes are provided at the end of the catalog:

- Part Number to Figure Number Index
- Vendor Code to Vendor Name Index
- Component Name to Figure Number Index

sections.content:

9 | A24311009 | Mounting Bracket | 2 | ALL | C
10 | A24311010 | Mounting Hardware Kit | 1 | ALL | B

3.2 BATTERY CONTACTOR ASSEMBLY

Figure 24-32-01: Battery Contactor Assembly

Item | Part Number | Description | Units Per Assembly | Effectivity | Spares Category
-----|-------------|-------------|-------------------|------------|----------------
1 | BAT-CONT-002 | Contactor, Battery, Main | 1 | MSN3650 and subsequent | A
2 | BAT-CONT-001 | Contactor, Battery, Main (superseded by BAT-CONT-002) | 1 | PRE-MSN3650 | A
3 | A24321002 | Mounting Bracket | 1 | ALL | C
4 | A24321003 | Terminal, Line Side | 2 | ALL | B
5 | A24321004 | Terminal, Load Side | 2 | ALL | B
6 | A24321005 | Coil Assembly | 1 | ALL | B
7 | A24321006 | Auxiliary Contact Assembly | 1 | ALL | B
8 | A24321007 | Arc Shield | 1 | ALL | C
9 | A24321008 | Terminal Cover | 1 | ALL | C
10 | A24321009 | Mounting Hardware Kit | 1 | ALL | B

NOTE: BAT-CONT-002 incorporates improved contact material with higher silver content. Refer to Service Bulletin SB-A320-24-001 (doc-007) and Airworthiness Directive AD-2025-05 (doc-008) for information on replacement requirements.

sections.title: Ordering Information
sections.content:
6.1 ORDERING PROCEDURES

To order parts listed in this catalog, contact Airbus Spares or an authorized distributor. When ordering, provide the following information:

1. Customer name and account number
2. Aircraft model and serial number
3. Part number
4. Quantity required
5. Desired delivery date
6. Shipping instructions
7. Purchase order number

6.2 AIRBUS SPARES CONTACT INFORMATION

Airbus Spares
Phone: +33-5-61-93-33-33
Fax: +33-5-61-93-44-44
Email: spares@airbus.com
Website: www.airbus.com/services/spares

6.3 AUTHORIZED DISTRIBUTORS

The following distributors are authorized to supply Airbus parts:

- Satair (An Airbus Company)
  Phone: +45-32-47-00-00
  Website: www.satair.com

- Proponent
  Phone: +1-714-252-6000
  Website: www.proponent.com

- Pattonair
  Phone: +44-1332-661010
  Website: www.pattonair.com

6.4 AOG SUPPORT

For Aircraft On Ground (AOG) situations requiring immediate parts support, contact:

Airbus AOG Desk
Phone: +33-5-61-93-34-34 (24/7 support)
Email: aog@airbus.com

6.5 PART SUBSTITUTION AND SUPERSEDURE

When a part has been superseded by a new part number, the new part number will be indicated in the catalog. Always order the latest part number unless specific circumstances require the original part.

If a direct replacement part is not available, contact Airbus Technical Support for approved substitutions:

Airbus Technical Support
Phone: +33-5-61-93-35-35
Email: techsupport@airbus.com
